data.title: Great Food
data.text: I went here for lunch between workshops, VERY busy - but worth it! The wait for a seated table was long, so I jumped in the "to go" line. Service was quick, great selection of soups hot and ready. Specialty sandwiched that include a pickle, of course!

data.title: Great soup and sandwiches
data.text: Isaac's is the best when it comes to soups and sandwiches.  Never left hungry or disappointed.  They have various other locations throughout Lancaster.

owner_response.author: Johnny R, Marketing Coordinator at Isaac's Pickle Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks, Barbi!  Always great to hear from customers letting us know how we're doing!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Neglectful and Skimpy
data.text: This was my 2nd visit to Isaacs, but the first was  over 20 years ago. As my husband and I were travelling through the area, and my memories of Isaacs were so good, I urged my husband to stop here for a late lunch/early dinner. Well, I do know now that it is not the same place, and I will not come back. I won't say it was terrible, but the whole experience was somewhere between average and poor. My first concern was the service. In my opinion, not knowing the draft list and under-informing us of what was available was one issue, but not a huge deal. However, having to remind the waitress to bring a drink and the mustard, or never receiving the requested knife were unforgivable. The real issue was the portion size consistency. I do recall the overstuffed sandwiched of years ago to be a bit over the top, so seeing that they were not the same was almost welcomed. My sandwich was normal, however, my husband's half sandwich was a different story. He ordered a soup/sandwich combo. The sandwich, which was a grilled turkey sandwich with melted cheese, bacon, and tomato had all the necessary elements...except for the turkey. He opened the sandwich to apply the mustard (yes, the same mustard that we had to request twice...and never received a knife to actually spread the mustard), and was quite surprised to find a sliver of lunchmeat-style turkey that would not be enough to feed a 2-yr old. Seriously, there was about a quarter to a half of a very thin slice of meat on his half sandwich. If I could give you a mental picture (and I wish I would have taken one) it was like 4-5 pieces of meat cut the size and thickness of a quarter. We are very conscientious eaters, as we are both very fit and slim, so it's not like we were wanting a Big Mac or anything of the sort...but this was ridiculous.  So ridiculous, in fact, that I called the waitress over to question as to whether this was a mistake. She looked at the sandwich and agreed that it must be some sort of mistake, apologized and took the sandwich back to the kitchen. Unfortunately, what was returned to us was not much better. This sandwich was the same sandwich that was removed from our table with 2 additional quarter-sized peices of meat on it. It was rather pathetic. The waitress apologized, and made some excuse that when a half-sandwich is ordered, the portion sizes are often uneven...but somehow the point was completely missed, and the problem was not fixed. I won't go back, and my memory is scarred.

owner_response.author: Johnny R, Marketing Coordinator at Isaac's Pickle Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi, Kirstan!

First let me apologize for the bad experience you had on your visit to our Downtown Lancaster.  Our goal is to always exceed our customers expectations, which we failed to do.  You said you were passing through the area but I would still like you to send an email to our Customer Happiness Coordinator, Debra Miller, at dmiller@isaacsdeli.com to let her know about your experience so we can make this up to you!  Would love you to give us a second chance on your next visit to the area to make you a fan again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Large menu
data.text:
One fact: confusing names of sandwiches after Birds (!) means when you order, it might be better to say what you want in your sandwich or you might get a different sandwich with a similar bird name.  Just sayin'.  I tried 3 of the homemade salads, only $1.99 each, and the seasonal kale, apple and walnut was delicious, as was the pesto tortellini.  
Service was good when waiter was there, but he seemed really busy and had to call him over a few times. Place has a friendly vibe and an extensive selection, though no pastrami!

owner_response.author: Johnny R, Marketing Coordinator at Isaac's Pickle Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the feedback about the menu.  Will pass your comments along to our Menu Committee which is always looking for ways to better our menu.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Excellent Isaac's!
data.text: We love Isaac's for their soups and sandwiches.  This particular Isaac's is excellent!!  There is also a bar in this restaurant so you can enjoy a craft beer with your meal.  Our server, Jess was wonderful!!

owner_response.author: Johnny R, Marketing Coordinator at Isaac's Pickle Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi, Michelle!
Thanks for the review!  Will let our team at this location know about your compliment for Jess, too!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great food
data.text: Love this place, great selection of  sandwiches, reasonably priced. Service is quick and staff are friendly

owner_response.author: Johnny R, Marketing Coordinator at Isaac's Pickle Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi, Emily!
Thanks for the review!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great sandwiches
data.text: Love. Isaacs sandwiches! Especially love the tomato soup! We visit at least once a month. Join their members club for discounts!

data.title: Mallard is my favorite . . . always
data.text: Every time I go to Isaac's, whether in downtown Lancaster or one of the satellites, it's consistently delicious, fresh, and reasonably priced.  They even have coupons and special discounts, so I always keep my eye open when my favorite sandwich is on sale for only $5.  I always say I'll try something new, but the Mallard just calls my name, especially with the "Ikie's" special sauce!  This place is an institution in this part of PA, and all the sandwiches are named for birds, which just indicates the level of creativity and thinking outside the box for the food served and the friendly waitstaff.

owner_response.author: Johnny R, Marketing Coordinator at Isaac's Pickle Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for the review!  We think the Mallard is pretty special ourselves! :-)
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Yummy Sammies
data.text: Isaac's sandwiches are original and so good!  If you're hungry for a good sandwich and a good beer you need check this place out!

owner_response.author: Johnny R, Marketing Coordinator at Isaac's Pickle Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks, Suz!  A great sandwich deserves a great beer so we try to have a nice line-up of crafts on draft!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Friendly and accomodating
data.text: Love the pickle bar. Great bartenders who remember what your favorite drink is. Food is usually good....although not consistent. It's not always as the menu tells you it is. Very fun place. Personable.

owner_response.author: Johnny R, Marketing Coordinator at Isaac's Pickle Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks for the review...and the shoutout to the bartenders!  If you ever have a problem with the food and it doesn't come out the way you expected it to, please let your server or the manager on duty know about it so we can fix it.  We definitely want you to have a great experience consistently!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good food in a no frills place, loved the never ending bowl of pickles
data.text: Server told us about special offers getting us a great sandwich and draft beer for just $9 per person.  Both the sandwich and the beer were delicious.  We loved the free bowls of pickled veggies for the table. Great location in downtown Lancaster.  Energetic & friendly servers.  Had similar good experience here last year.  Happy to see they have kept up the good work

owner_response.author: Johnny R, Marketing Coordinator at Isaac's Pickle Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I'm very addicted to the pickle mix that goes out to each table!  I think they truly make the meal!  Thanks for your review...will definitely share with our team at the Pickle Bar!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: PIckles, Pickles, and more Pickles!
data.text: We recently ate at Issac's in Lancaster.  The menu is diverse, lots of options, many unique sandwiches and salads.  The pickle bar was the most talked about.  Unfortunately it is not a serve yourself pickle bar as expected.  But the server continued to deliver bowls of pickles as requested.  We had six people so we consumed a lot of bowls of pickles.  The food was excellent and fresh.

data.title: Excellent Lunch Spot
data.text: Great food, drink, and atmosphere in downtown Lancaster. Delicious menu choices for all, even children.

owner_response.author: Johnny R, Marketing Coordinator at Isaac's Pickle Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the review, Mike!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: First Time, Great Surprise
data.text: We went to lunch with friends that live in this area and we were pleasantly surprised,  Great restaurant.  Sandwiches were really good and the service was good too.  Love the pickles they put on the table.  Also have gluten free options.

owner_response.author: Johnny R, Marketing Coordinator at Isaac's Pickle Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hope it's the first of many visits, Kathy! :-)  Be sure to try the Pepperjack Tomato Soup if you haven't already.  This location actually has it featured as part of an appetizer called Pepperjack Shooters...a grilled cheese sandwich cut up into 4 triangles with each wedge on a small glass of Pepperjack Tomato Soup...it's awesome!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: MUST HAVE SANDWICH
data.text: This is a very nice place to go to if you want a good sandwich, and a very good location, with in walking distance from everything.

owner_response.author: Johnny R, Marketing Coordinator at Isaac's Pickle Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Pickle Bar
data.text: Good cocktails, nice city scenery, good service. Parking is not as close as I would have liked, but there is a lot across the street.

data.title: Run the Other Way
data.text: How can you ruin a salad?  Easily! Just use poor quality ingredients.  Went in for a quick salad.  Requested Romaine. Don't know what it was, but was definitely not fresh..

owner_response.author: Johnny R, Marketing Coordinator at Isaac's Pickle Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi, Ron!
Sorry to hear about the bad salad you received on your recent visit to Isaac's Pickle Bar.  It sounds like you may have not talked to a manager about this so I'd like you to send an email to our Customer Happiness Coordinator, Debra Miller, at dmiller@isaacsdeli.com so we can take care of this for you.

We pride ourselves on using fresh ingredients to make our sandwiches and salads.  We have great local vendors that we use to get these ingredients so if we hear of an incident like this we like to do follow-up and correct any mishaps or errors that may have occurred. 

I hope you contact Debra so we can make this right for you and have you give us another chance when you visit the area again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: this Isaac's is like every isaacs
data.text: Well if you have been to one of them you have been to all of them i wouldn't say there was anything special about the experience but there wasn't anything negative either. If you like eating food they have some good food but the sandwiches are kind of small.

data.title: typical sandwich shop
data.text: You get what you would expect. Nothing special but it's still good. Some of the locations have bars. It's also popular for take out

data.title: Very over priced sandwiches you could have made at home
data.text: Very over priced sandwiches you could have made at home.  It's like a deluxe version of subway with pickles.

owner_response.author: Johnny R, Marketing Coordinator at Isaac's Pickle Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Feedback both good and bad is important to us.  Our goal is to always wow our customers but it doesn't look like we hit that mark on your last visit.  We pride ourselves on making sandwiches to order using, fresh ingredients and then grilling them in a unique way so that they are different from the way you just described.

Please contact our general manager at this location, Emily Files, at efiles@isaacsdeli.com and let her know about your experience so we can find a way to make this up to you and invite you back for another visit.
owner_response.title: Owner Response
